title: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal: The spectacular rise of a Macron stalwart
summary: Attal, until now the education minister – and one of the most popular members of the French government – was promoted on Tuesday, January 9. A former Socialist, he joined Emmanuel Macron's ranks in 2016.

title: Hezbollah's elite Radwan force is in Israel's sights
summary: A senior commander of the highly secretive unit, deployed on Lebanon's southern border, was killed in an Israeli army strike on January 8.

title: French hacker Sébastien Raoult sentenced in the US to three years in prison
summary: The 22-year-old from France belonged to the ShinyHunters hacking collective, known for illicitly accessing the personal and financial data of unsuspecting individuals

title: BBC Slovak journalist suspected of being Czechoslovak secret service agent in London
summary: According to an investigation by the UK's 'Daily Mail' newspaper, Terezia Javorska is suspected of having relayed information to the Czechoslovak Communist intelligence services in the 1980s, although the specifics of her involvement remain uncertain.

title: Trump confident he should be immune to prosecution but judges aren't so sure
summary: Former US president Donald Trump claims that he should be immune from prosecution, but a panel of judges seem sceptical. Trump also warned there would be 'bedlam' if his prosecution goes ahead.

title: Getting sterilized before the age of 30: 'Young women who come for a tubal ligation don't do it on a whim'
summary: For young adults with no children and no desire to have any, access to tubal ligation or vasectomy for contraceptive purposes is still an obstacle course.

title: Biden unaware of defense secretary's cancer diagnosis
summary: The White House admitted on Tuesday that the US president was uninformed about Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin's prostate cancer surgery and hospital stay, prompting concerns over transparency in the world's leading military leadership.

title: Polish police arrest convicted politicians at president's palace amid escalating government dispute
summary: Polish police on Tuesday arrested two politicians convicted of abuse of power who had taken refuge for hours in the palace of President Andrzej Duda in a dramatic escalation of a standoff between the new and previous governments.

title: Ecuador: Armed gang members take over live TV broadcast
summary: Ecuador's president declared the country in a state of 'internal armed conflict' just hours after gangsters declared 'war' in an escalating security crisis sparked by the prison escape of one of Ecuador's most powerful criminal bosses.

title: Police officers go on trial for 2017 assault on Black man that shocked France
summary: Three policemen went on trial in France on Tuesday over an assault during a stop and search in 2017 that left a man disabled, causing shock across the country and sparking protests.

title: Spanish authorities declare environmental emergency as plastic pellets wash up on beaches
summary: The government has launched an investigation after a shipping container fell off a transport boat last month, polluting European waters with plastic.

title: First private US lunar lander mission fails
summary: A fuel leak has dashed an American company's hopes of its lunar lander touching down on the Moon.

title: US delays planned return of astronauts to Moon until 2026
summary: The next trip around the Moon won't be until next year – while the next Moon landing may not be for another few years, NASA said, after a series of technical issues.

title: Elisabeth Borne's tumultuous tenure as French prime minister
summary: The head of the French government announced her departure as Emmanuel Macron seeks a new profile to kick-start his second five-year term.

title: First partial heart transplant in a newborn baby deemed a success
summary: A year after an innovative new heart transplant procedure was carried out on a newborn, American doctors consider it a success.

title: Alaska Airlines' near-crash: A miracle for passengers, a catastrophe for Boeing
summary: With the latest accident to affect the American aircraft manufacturer's 737 Max, the very ability of the company to produce its aircraft quickly and efficiently is being called into question.

title: France closes major motorways as cold snap hits
summary: People were forced to sleep in their cars on Monday night after motorways became hazardous due to black ice. Temperatures were expected to drop further on Tuesday.

title: Supply of F-16s to Ukraine: Pilot training ramps up
summary: Kyiv hopes that Western fighter jets will improve the situation on the front line by using their superior radar range and air-to-air missile capabilities against Russian forces.

title: France's defense industry threatened by new competitors
summary: South Korea, Turkey and Israel are formidable competitors for the French military-industrial sector which, despite its strengths and its position as the world's third largest arms exporter, has a number of shortcomings.

title: Boeing CEO takes responsibility for Alaska Airlines incident
summary: Dave Calhoun on Tuesday promised to deal with the issue with 'complete transparency every step of the way' and acknowledged the company's 'mistake.'

title: Erotic fantasies, a secret garden to be cultivated
summary: Sexual fantasy is increasingly evaporating under the blows of technology and self-censorship, observes columnist Maïa Mazaurette, who pleads for maintaining the right to engage in erotic reveries without moral judgment.

title: Natural disasters cause $250 billion in annual damages, a 'new normal' for insurers
summary: According to reinsurer Munich Re, insured losses fell by nearly 25% in 2023, dropping to $95 billion from 2022's $125 billion. Meanwhile, storm-related damages have escalated to record highs.

title: Chinese military tells US it will 'never compromise' on Taiwan
summary: Chinese military officials urged their US counterparts to stop 'provocative actions' in the South China Sea at talks this week in Washington, Beijing said Wednesday.

title: Kenya: Alternative rites of passage play key role in the fight against female genital mutilation
summary: NGOs have worked on the delicate exercise of implementing alternatives in Masai communities, where female genital mutilation continues to be practiced on a massive scale, despite it being banned since 2011.

title: 2023 was the Earth's hottest year by far
summary: Almost half of the year exceeded the critical 1.5°C threshold, beyond which climate impacts are more likely to become self-reinforcing and catastrophic, according to scientists.

title: 'The destabilizing shockwave of a Trump re-election would reach far beyond Europe'
summary: With polls showing him as the favorite, it's not too early to assess the impact of a second term for the former Republican president. His victory would have a profoundly destabilizing effect on international relations, explains columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: JPR Williams, Wales and British Lions rugby legend, dies aged 74
summary: A three-time Five Nations Grand Slam winner with his country, he also boasted an unbeaten record in eight Tests as a Lion in historic triumphant tours to New Zealand in 1971 and 1974 in South Africa.

title: French PM Attal's other challenge: Countering the far-right in European elections
summary: The new Prime Minister is expected to be a campaign leader, as the presidential bloc has only 5 months to overtake Le Pen's Rassemblement National, which is leading in the European election polls.

title: 'By appointing a strong figure as PM Macron has – finally! – shown he is capable of reforming himself'
summary: By appointing Gabriel Attal, the French president has implicitly conceded that he needs his youth and popularity to breathe new life into his second term, writes Le Monde columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: EU may lower protection status of wolves
summary: Farmers have long called for the change, due to the predator's impact on livestock. But the move is also being denounced by environmental protection organizations.

title: David Chase: 'A lot of what was in The Sopranos was me and my life and my parents'
summary: To celebrate the 25th anniversary of the first episode of the series that revolutionized American television fiction, its creator spoke to Le Monde about its groundbreaking beginnings.

title: Bhutan dreams of building the first 'mindfulness' city
summary: The Himalayan kingdom, which  has chosen to prioritize the environment over growth, is facing a 'brain drain.'

title: The risky gamble of naming Gabriel Attal prime minister
summary: As former government spokesman and education minister, the new French PM is no stranger to the challenges ahead. But does his appointment come too soon?

title: Uranus and Neptune reveal their true colors
summary: A study reveals that the two ice giants are of a similar greenish-blue hue, with far less contrast than the images taken by the American Voyager 2 space probe in the 1980s would have us believe.

title: Post Office scandal: UK to exonerate and compensate wrongly convicted staff
summary: One of Britain's 'greatest miscarriages of justice,' the wrongful conviction of hundreds of Post Office workers due to faulty software has exploded into the public domain following a TV drama, with demands for justice for those targeted.

title: US experiences 'historic' drop in crime rates, contrary to public perception
summary: According to a recent study, murders declined by almost 13% in 2023 and burglaries were down by more than 6%. But this hasn't stopped the majority of Americans from being convinced that the situation is getting worse instead of better.

title: What we know about the unfolding violence in Ecuador
summary: At least 10 people have been killed in a series of attacks blamed on gangs as the country is becoming engulfed by what the president called an 'internal armed conflict.'

title: Amazon's live-streaming platform Twitch cuts 500 jobs
summary: Twitch has recently suffered an exodus of top executives amid a massive cost-cutting campaign across Amazon units.

title: Europe faced migration resurgence from Africa in 2023
summary: The number of migrants and refugees coming to Europe by sea has risen by two-thirds, mostly via Tunisia and the Canary Islands.

title: Italy's government under fire from opposition after fascist rally in Rome
summary: Italy's interior minister said on Wednesday that dozens of people who made the fascist salute in Rome on Sunday behaved 'contrary to our democratic culture,' following opposition party pressure on Prime Minister Meloni.

title: Judge bars  Trump from giving his own closing argument at his civil fraud trial
summary: The trial could cost Trump hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties and strip him of his ability to do business in New York

title: WHO warns Covid-19 still poses a deadly threat
summary: Besides the almost 10,000 deaths reported to the WHO in December, there was a 42% increase in hospitalizations and a 62% increase in intensive care unit admissions, compared with November.
